body_html:
I'm observing the same problem on our SGE cluster. Here is more info from my local experience.

  1. We have a variety of different GPUs in our cluster. The job runs flawlessly in all GPUs except Tesla P40's. This is true for K80 and GTX1080 GPUs, which have less memory. This makes me conclude this is not a memory issue.
  2. If I qrsh login to a Tesla P40 node (interactive session), then the job works on that node.

So, my understanding is that the environment in which the job is executed triggers this problem. If you have any other ideas, I can test it on our cluster.
body_text:

We have a variety of different GPUs in our cluster.  The job runs flawlessly in all GPUs except Tesla P40's.  This is true for K80 and GTX1080 GPUs, which have less memory.  This makes me conclude this is not a memory issue.
If I qrsh login to a Tesla P40 node (interactive session), then the job works on that node.

So, my understanding is that the environment in which the job is executed triggers this problem.  If you have any other ideas, I can test it on our cluster.
body:
I'm observing the same problem on our SGE cluster.  Here is more info from my local experience.

1. We have a variety of different GPUs in our cluster.  The job runs flawlessly in all GPUs except Tesla P40's.  This is true for K80 and GTX1080 GPUs, which have less memory.  This makes me conclude this is not a memory issue.
2. If I qrsh login to a Tesla P40 node (interactive session), then the job works on that node.

So, my understanding is that the environment in which the job is executed triggers this problem.  If you have any other ideas, I can test it on our cluster.
